reporter_caption.center: ST. LAURENT v. KAISER ALUMINUM CHEMICAL CORP., 113 R.I. 953 (1974)

caption.center: ROBERT ST. LAURENT v. KAISER ALUMINUM CHEMICAL CORPORATION.

opinion.posture: Upon representation of petitioner's counsel that the counsel fee in question has been paid, petitioner's motion to adjudge respondent in contempt is denied as being moot.
opinion.attorneys:
Lovett Linder, Ltd., Raul L. Lovett, for petitioner.
Ambrose W. Carroll, for respondent.
